title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message: this machine was powering on even after a cola spilled on it. i decided to clean it for safe measure and now it doesn't power up. i found short to ground on pp3v1_rtc. i'm new to the touchbar logic boards. i looked at the schematic but i'm still lost as to which chip creates pp3v1_rtc and is it safe to inject 3 volts since this rail goes directly to the cpu

title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message:
Voltage comes out from U7800.
And can be PCH, or U7800 fault.

If is not really short, then is possible to be crap under one of it; put good flux and heat for test.
If is a very low value (000-003), you can try injecting voltage.

There are also 2-3 caps which you can check fiest.

title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message: i have removed u7800 from the board and 3v1_rtc still has very low resistance to ground. is this value coming from pch_intruder_l? R1401 has very low resistance on both sides

title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message:
R1401 has 1M, so cannot generate such fail.
But if you have short to ground in two different points of PCH (VCCRTC and INTRUDER) that points to bad PCH 100%...

title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message: the machine was booting fine. all i did was ultrasonic the board

title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message:
"put good [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/amtech-nc-559-v2-30-cc-16160.html"]flux[/URL] and heat for test."
But I doubt it will help in this case...

"all i did was [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/crest-p500h-45.html"]ultrasonic[/URL] the board"
No sweep function???
How many minutes left the board in the UC?

title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message: removed the caps from the rail and i check them then i put them back and the short went away. maybe the heat got to the pch

title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message: well i'm waiting on a stencil that i  ordered to put u7800 back on the board but i'm confident that the short was the issue

title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message: all_sys_pwrgd is 0v unless i heat up the pch area a little. i guess this thing needs a reflow

title: 820-00840 short on pp3v1_rtc
message: c7934 must've moved off the pad when i removed the pmic.  that was the issue
